episodeTitle: Feudal Era Side Story - Defeat Thriller Company's Trap
description: In this special historical episode set in feudal Japan, Robin reveals Brook's past connection to Thriller Company. After Brook is captured, Luffy and Zoro rescue him. The crew participates in a mikoshi race where they face off against Thriller Company's Oars-shaped shrine with their Thousand Sunny-modeled shrine.

events.title: Robin Reveals Brook's Past
events.description: Robin explains Brook's background to Luffy and the crew, revealing that he was formerly connected to Thriller Company but left due to disagreement with their methods. The crew decides to help Brook based on this information.
events.significance: This backstory establishes the conflict for the episode and motivates the crew to help Brook, setting up the confrontation with Thriller Company.

events.title: Crew Decides to Help Brook
events.description: After hearing Brook's story from Robin, Luffy and his friends make the decision to help Brook escape from Thriller Company and support him in the upcoming mikoshi race.
events.significance: This decision commits the crew to the main conflict of the episode and demonstrates their loyalty to helping those in need, even in this alternate universe setting.

events.title: Brook Captured by Thriller Company
events.description: Brook is captured by Thriller Company (Hogback, Perona, and Absalom) who want to prevent him from interfering with their plans to win the mikoshi race.
events.significance: This capture raises the stakes for the episode and forces Luffy and Zoro to mount a rescue operation, adding urgency to the narrative.

events.title: Luffy and Zoro Rescue Brook
events.description: Luffy and Zoro arrive to rescue Brook from Thriller Company's clutches. They successfully free him, allowing him to rejoin the crew for the mikoshi race.
events.significance: This rescue demonstrates the crew's combat effectiveness and their commitment to helping Brook, setting up their participation in the race.

events.title: Mikoshi Rebuilt and Race Begins
events.description: The crew rebuilds their mikoshi, which is modeled after the Thousand Sunny. The race officially begins with Thriller Company fielding an Oars-shaped mikoshi as their competition.
events.significance: The mikoshi race is the central event of this episode, bringing together the feudal Japanese setting with One Piece references through the shrine designs.

events.title: Thriller Company Activates Motorized Wheels
events.description: During the race, the Thriller Company zombies become too tired to carry their mikoshi. Hogback activates hidden motorized wheels to gain an advantage. Franky responds by doing the same with the Pinwheel Eatery mikoshi, fueling it with cola.
events.significance: This moment showcases the technological creativity of both sides and introduces the cola fuel mechanic that becomes crucial later in the race.

events.title: Thriller Company Attacks with Cannon
events.description: Thriller Company fires a cannon at the Pinwheel Eatery mikoshi, knocking them into the nearby river. However, the mikoshi proves to be water-worthy and continues the race.
events.significance: This attack demonstrates Thriller Company's willingness to cheat and sabotage their opponents, while also showcasing Franky's superior engineering.

events.title: Running Out of Cola
events.description: Franky's mikoshi runs out of cola fuel while in the water, leaving them unable to escape or continue the race. This creates a critical moment where they need to find more cola.
events.significance: This complication raises the tension and creates a problem that needs immediate solving, showcasing teamwork.

events.title: Onami and Mao Get Cola
events.description: Onami and Mao take cola from a nearby stand to refuel Franky's mikoshi, allowing them to continue the race and use their ultimate weapon.
events.significance: This moment shows the quick thinking and resourcefulness of the supporting characters, enabling the climactic confrontation.

events.title: Franky Uses Gaon Cannon
events.description: With fresh cola fuel, Franky activates the Gaon Cannon built into the mikoshi, completely destroying Thriller Company's Oars-shaped mikoshi and securing victory for the Pinwheel Eatery team.
events.significance: This spectacular attack serves as the climax of the race and demonstrates Franky's engineering prowess in this alternate universe.

events.title: Cindry Abandons Thriller Company
events.description: The Thriller Company discovers that Cindry has abandoned them and is watching from the audience, having chosen not to participate in their schemes.
events.significance: This reveals a crack in Thriller Company's unity and adds a layer of complexity to the antagonists.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Thriller Company
events.description: After winning the race, Luffy punches Hogback, Perona, and Absalom into the sky for disrupting the festival and their various misdeeds during the race.
events.significance: This serves as the final defeat of the episode's antagonists and provides a satisfying conclusion to the conflict.

events.title: Prize Revealed as Magical Panties
events.description: The sacred treasure prize for winning the mikoshi race is revealed to be a pair of golden panties that supposedly grant any wish when worn by a beautiful woman.
events.significance: This comedic reveal subverts expectations and sets up the episode's final gag. The absurd nature of the prize fits the lighthearted tone of the filler episode.

events.title: Brook Punched Out, Loses Memory
events.description: Brook suggests that Mao should wear the magical panties prize. Mao responds by punching him unconscious, which once again erases Brook's memory in this continuity.
events.significance: This comedic ending ties back to Brook's recurring memory loss issue established in episode 406, creating a cyclical narrative for the character in this arc.

events.title: Igaram Withholds Prize Money
events.description: Despite the Pinwheel Eatery team winning the race, Igaram refuses to give Onami the prize money, stating that it needs to be used to repair the collateral damage the racers caused to the town during the competition.
events.significance: This bittersweet ending prevents the heroes from profiting from their victory, adding a realistic consequence to their destructive race tactics.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the crew's willingness to help Brook despite his connection to their enemies, demonstrating their values of loyalty and helping those in need.
themes.symbolism: The mikoshi race represents teamwork and cooperation, with the crew working together to overcome obstacles.

themes.description: Both Franky's engineering prowess and the crew's quick thinking (getting cola, using the Gaon Cannon) showcase their ability to adapt and overcome challenges.
themes.symbolism: The Thousand Sunny-shaped mikoshi represents the crew's identity and unity even in this alternate universe.

themes.theme: Good vs. Evil in a Lighthearted Context
themes.description: While the episode features a clear conflict between heroes and villains, the stakes are kept deliberately low and comedic, fitting the filler episode format.
themes.symbolism: The absurd prize (magical panties) symbolizes the non-serious nature of this alternate universe story.

characterSpotlights.development: Franky's engineering skills are highlighted as he builds and operates the mikoshi, using the Gaon Cannon to secure victory.
keyActions: Uses Gaon Cannon to destroy enemy mikoshi

characterSpotlights.development: Brook's past with Thriller Company is revealed, and he receives help from the crew. The episode ends with him losing his memory again after his inappropriate suggestion to Mao.
keyActions: Has his past revealed by Robin
Is rescued by Luffy and Zoro
Suggests Mao wear the magical panties

characterSpotlights.development: Boss Luffy demonstrates his leadership by deciding to help Brook and his combat prowess by defeating the Thriller Company villains.
keyActions: Punches Thriller Company members into the sky

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original filler content not based on any manga chapter. It is part of the Boss Luffy Historical Special series set in an alternate universe.

trivia.fact: Episode 407 has an IMDb rating of 5.6/10, one of the lower ratings for One Piece episodes, likely due to its filler status and departure from the main storyline.
This is the second part of a two-episode special featuring Boss Luffy in a feudal Japanese setting, with the first part being episode 406.
The Boss Luffy Historical Special episodes are set in Grand Jipangu, an alternate universe version of feudal Japan featuring One Piece characters in different roles.

sources.title: Boss Luffy Historical Special - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode aired during the same period as the Sabaody Archipelago arc in the main storyline, providing lighter filler content between intense canon episodes.

sources.title: List of One Piece episodes (seasons 9-14) - Wikipedia

trivia.fact: Mao, who appears as a waitress in this episode, is based on famous Japanese actress Mao Kobayashi.
This was the final episode to use 'Share the World' by TVXQ (Tohoshinki) as the opening theme, which spanned episodes 395-407 before being replaced by 'Kaze wo Sagashite' starting with episode 408.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki
